bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, September 30, 1899

div1.p: Lazear discusses his new lodgings and provides family news.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, September 30, 1899
div1.opener:
DR. JESSE W. LAZEAR,
835 PARK AVE.
OFFICE HOURS,
4.30-6 P. M.
BALTIMORE. Sep. 30. 99
My dear Mother,-
div1.p:
I have been wondering
how it is at Hatley since the cold
weather set in. It has really
been very cold here and a heavy
frost is expected tonight. I imagine
you are having even more of it.

I hope this will reach you Monday
before you start. It has been a
very nice summer in every way bad
I am glad we all went to Hatley.
Mabel and the baby are looking
so well and I am as strong
as a horse. I think you will
find that it has benefitted you
also. Mrs. Symington is here now
Mr Symington is also here for Sunday.
Mabel wants me to tell you that she
left your Ibsen book at the Howse's.
We have finally turned the third story
room into a nursery. It is a bright
DR. JESSE W. LAZEAR,
835 PARK AVE.
OFFICE HOURS,
4.30-6 P. M.
BALTIMORE,
Sunshine room and looks very
nice with Buster and his belongings
in it. The other day the little man
shook the side of his bed loose
and tumbled out on the floor. It bunged
his face up but seems to have
done no other damage. He is
extremely cunning and attractive and
enjoys life very much.

I hope you will soon be down
and see him again. Do you
expect to go out to Windsor?

I have not yet arranged about
an office. I am not going to
hurry about it. If I change again
I want it to be to a place
thoroughly satisfactory.
